ğŸ“¦ Installation1. PrerequisitesEnsure you have an NVIDIA GPU and Python 3.10+.2. Setup GPU Drivers (Mandatory)Before installing the library, you must install the CUDA-enabled version of PyTorch.Bashpip install torch torchvision --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu121
3. Install Skeleton-NitroOnce Torch is ready, install the engine:Bashpip install skeleton-nitro
ğŸš€ UsageYou can run the engine directly from your terminal using the built-in CLI:Example 1: Generate Skeleton Dataset (Standard)Converts images to 1-pixel skeletons and creates 10 augmented versions of each.Bashskeleton-nitro --input "C:/data/raw_tamil" --output "D:/skeleton_results" --mode skeleton --aug 10
Example 2: Bulk Grayscale ConversionSimply resizes and grayscales images without skeletonization.Bashskeleton-nitro --input "C:/data/raw_tamil" --output "D:/gray_results" --mode grayscale

Time (1M Images)Standard CPU (Skimage)~0.5 img/s23 DaysNitro GPU Engine~25.0 img/s11 Hoursâš™ï¸ Configuration Flags--input: (Required) Path to the root folder of your raw images.--output: (Required) Path where the processed dataset will be saved.--mode: Either skeleton (default) or grayscale.--aug: Number of random rotations/shears to generate per image (default: 1).--batch: Batch size for GPU processing (default: 100). Lower this if you have low VRAM.
